Class ShopImp

java.lang.Object
org.example.ShopImp
All Implemented Interfaces:
Shop
public final class ShopImp extends Object implements Shop
This is the primary system implementation for the java computer shop application
.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ShopImp()
    This constructor does not take in any parameters or return any values, instead it initialises the tables for the shop on first run

    Method
    Description
    void
    addCustomer(String name, int age, double currentBal)
    Given a concrete name age and balance, a customer object and added via sqlite
    void
    addMoneyToCustAccount(int id, double amount)
    Given an id and amount of money to add a customers balance will be updated with this amount, like an atm We grab their balance using the static getCustomerBalance method and then add the balance and new amount in order to update their original balance
    void
    displayCustomerInfo(int id)
    Given a concrete id, all relevant details relating to a customer can be listed.
    void
    listCurrentStock()
    This method reads the names,stock and productNo from the computers table to inform the user on the stock levels so they know what computers they can even buy beforehand
    void
    listItems()
    This implementation reads the computers table and lists all information relating to the items we sell
    void
    listRecentOrders()
    This method lists all orders coming in by looping over all info in the orders table If there is no orders the output will just be blank
    void
    purchaseItem(int productID, int customerID)
    Given a concrete id and productNo a customer is able to purchase an item which both adjusts their balance and our stock levels.
    void
    removeCustomer(int id, String name)
    Given a concrete name and id, a customer can be fully removed from the sqlite database.
    void
    saveReceipt(Order o)
    This method saves a receipt with information taken from the order class in order to save as a txt file with the customers order no as the name of the txt fie.

      public void listCurrentStock()
      This method reads the names,stock and productNo from the computers table to inform the user on the stock levels so they know what computers they can even buy beforehand

    • removeCustomer

      public void removeCustomer(int id, String name)
      Given a concrete name and id, a customer can be fully removed from the sqlite database. This method takes in some details about the customer to ensure its actually them such as a username and an id and if so they will have the account removed
      Specified by:
      removeCustomer in interface Shop
      Parameters:
      id - - int unique id customer
      name - - String name of the customer

    • displayCustomerInfo

      public void displayCustomerInfo(int id)
      Given a concrete id, all relevant details relating to a customer can be listed. This is achieved by taking in and id from the customer via the cli and from there grabbing this data from the sqlite db
      Specified by:
      displayCustomerInfo in interface Shop
      Parameters:
      id - - int unique id customer to find display info

    • addMoneyToCustAccount

      public void addMoneyToCustAccount(int id, double amount)
      Given an id and amount of money to add a customers balance will be updated with this amount, like an atm We grab their balance using the static getCustomerBalance method and then add the balance and new amount in order to update their original balance
      Specified by:
      addMoneyToCustAccount in interface Shop
      Parameters:
      id - - int unique id of customer
      amount - - double amount of money to be added to customer account

    • purchaseItem

      public void purchaseItem(int productID, int customerID)
      Given a concrete id and productNo a customer is able to purchase an item which both adjusts their balance and our stock levels. this is the heart of all our code and where most other fields and methods come together to form the shops purchasing system. A customer order will be created, the stock will be decremented and money will be taken out of the customers account.
      Specified by:
      purchaseItem in interface Shop
      Parameters:
      productID - - product no of which customer will buy
      customerID - - int unique id of the customer

    • listRecentOrders

      public void listRecentOrders()
      This method lists all orders coming in by looping over all info in the orders table If there is no orders the output will just be blank
      Specified by:
      listRecentOrders in interface Shop

    • saveReceipt

      public void saveReceipt(Order o)
      This method saves a receipt with information taken from the order class in order to save as a txt file with the customers order no as the name of the txt fie. Here we se file writer as a means of creating AND writing into this file
      Specified by:
      saveReceipt in interface Shop
      Parameters:
      o - - Order created by customer to model the receipt
